title: Single slit - wavelength from dark fringe spacing

content.question: A laser beam is directed through a screen with a narrow vertical slit of width <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>, forming a pattern that can be viewed on a second screen, as shown in the figure. The two screens are a distance <math alttext="uppercase D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> apart, the viewing screen has a width of <math alttext="w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>w</mi></math>, and adjacent dark fringes in the pattern are a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> apart. What is the approximate wavelength of the laser beam?
